VariableName: Capacity of power generation from prime movers (pm)
Long_Description: Capacity of power generation from Prime Movers (PM) in Mega Watt (MW) Prime movers typically refer to the main engines or turbines used in power plants, such as steam turbines, gas turbines, or diesel generators

VariableName: Capacity of power generation from fuel oil (fo)
Long_Description: Capacity of power generation from Fuel Oil (FO) in Mega Watt (MW) Fuel oil is a type of liquid fuel derived from petroleum, and it is commonly used in power plants as a source of energy

VariableName: Capacity of power generation from other sources
Long_Description: Capacity of power generation from other sources in Mega Watt (MW) The Other sources may include alternative or renewable energy sources like solar, wind, hydroelectric, or biomass, depending on the specific power generation system

VariableName: Total capacity of power generation from all sources
Long_Description: Total capacity of power generation from all sources combined in Mega Watt (MW) Prime Movers (PM) + Fuel Oil (FO) + Other sources
